intro: Pimpinella cretica var. arabica, commonly known as the Cretan cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. It thrives in rocky and coastal areas, often growing in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
